step1.sentence: The best entrepreneurs learn from failure and use those hard lessons to build something better the next time.

step2.story: After his startup collapsed, Marcus spent weeks going over every decision he had made. He realized that learning from failure was more valuable than any business school course. With a clearer mind and sharper instincts, he launched his second venture — and this time it stuck.

step3.story: When Sara's first app was pulled from the store due to poor user reviews, she felt crushed. But instead of giving up, she sat down with the feedback and began to learn from failure, line by line. She rewrote the onboarding flow, simplified the interface, and reached out personally to users who had complained. Six months later, the app relaunched to a warm reception and a far more loyal community. Sara often told her team that the original flop was the best thing that ever happened to the product. Without it, they would never have known what truly mattered to their users.

meaning.realUsageKo: 단순한 위로의 표현이 아니라, 실패를 분석하고 다음 시도를 개선하는 능동적인 과정을 강조할 때 사용한다. 자기계발, 비즈니스, 교육 맥락에서 폭넓게 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'learn'은 고대 영어 'leornian(따라가다, 익히다)'에서 유래했으며, 'failure'는 라틴어 'fallere(속이다, 실수하다)'에 어원을 둔다. 두 단어가 결합해 실패를 통한 성장이라는 개념을 표현하게 됐다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 성장 지향적인 뉘앙스를 담고 있다. 실패 자체를 미화하지 않으면서도, 그것을 낭비하지 않겠다는 의지를 담아 말할 때 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She chose to learn from failure rather than dwell on it.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 실패에 집착하는 대신 그로부터 배우기로 했다.
